intro: Phlox pulvinata, commonly known as the showy phlox, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 feet. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, showy flowers in shades of pink, lavender, and white. Its foliage is dark green and lance-shaped, providing a striking contrast to the floral display. Phlox pulvinata thrives in full sun to partial shade and is well-suited for garden landscapes.
